discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. The business requirement states that WAN access failure for dual circuits into the same MPLS provider cannot happen due to costly service credits. Although the circuits are diversely routed to different points of presence (PoPs) on the providerâ€™s network, the single-provider dependency remains a risk.

Selected Answer: D
The best approach to ensure WAN access availability and redundancy without adding unnecessary complexity or cost is dual homing the remote branches to the MPLS network (Option D). This ensures that the remote branches always have a backup connection, addressing potential failures at the branch level while maintaining high availability for the data center access.

Selected Answer: B
Vote for B as well. Right answer

I even think it is D. On old customer of mine required for us to route to different POPs, based on their CE to PE routing, until they reached the DCs. This is simply one of the worst wordings of a question by Cisco at this level. Make ppl guess is not a reflection of good pedagogy. I know my stuff, this wording will not reflect my knowledge.

Selected Answer: B
B for sure.

Selected Answer: A
Additional MPLS provider (which would also require all remote branches to have access to second MPLS provider as well) seems like "gold plating"

questions.question_text: A business requirement stating that failure of WAN access for dual circuits into an MPLS provider for a Data Centre cannot happen due to related service credits that would need to be paid has led to diversely routed circuits to different points of presence on the providers network? What should a network designer also consider as part of the requirement?

choices.C: Out of band access to the MPLS routers
choices.D: Ensuring all related remote branches are dual homed to the MPLS network
choices.A: Dual PSUs & Supervisors on each MPLS router
choices.B: Provision of an additional MPLS provider

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
PPDIOO (Prepare, Plan, Design, Implement, Operate, Optimize). 
PPDIOO is a Cisco methodology that provides a structured and systematic approach to network lifecycle management. It is widely recognized and used in the industry to guide the design, implementation, and ongoing operation of network infrastructure. The PPDIOO lifecycle approach helps ensure that networks are designed and implemented effectively, and that they continue to meet the evolving needs of the organization over time.

questions.question_text: Which methodology is the leading lifecycle approach to network design and implementation?
An external edge router provides connectivity from a service provider to an enterprise. Which two Internet edge best practices meet compliance regulations? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
I suggest C is less appropriate as the best practice to meet regulations.

Selected Answer: CE
CE are the most correct answers.
Of course logging and ebgp advertising of our own blocks are correct, but not for compliance.

comments.content:
Logging is required but no need to centralized.
Interface access lists must be implemented at outside interface.
I choose CE.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
AC are the answer

choices.C: Enable and use only secure protocols
choices.A: Send logs to a centralized logging collection server
choices.D: Implement filtering to control traffic that is sourced from the infrastructure IP space
choices.E: Use login banners and interface access lists to restrict administrative access to the system
choices.B: Implement EBGP to advertise all owned IP blocks

discussion.content: B is correct ans as suggested

Selected Answer: B
PaaS (Platform as a Service)

comments.content: Yes. PaaS goes a step further and abstracts away the management of the operating system, middleware, and runtime. SaaS provides the entire end-user application as-a-Service, abstracting away the entire rest of the stack(too much).https://www.ibm.com/topics/iaas#:~:text=IaaS%20abstracts%20away%20the%20physical,system%2C%20middleware%2C%20and%20runtime.
PaaS and SaaS both models are correct, but I think PaaS is better answer here, if we move from on-prem to XaaS model.

questions.question_text: Which service abstracts away the management of the operating system, middleware, and runtime?
What is a web-based model in which a third-party provider hosts applications that are available to customers over the Internet?

discussion.content:
Software as a service (SaaS)
Software as a service (SaaS) is a software distribution model in which a cloud provider hosts applications and makes them available to end users over the internet. In this model, an independent software vendor (ISV) may contract a third-party cloud provider to host the application.

Selected Answer: D
D. SaaS (Software as a Service)

Selected Answer: D
Hosting applications is SaaS

Selected Answer: B
B. his VNID provides a unique identifier for the network within the VXLAN overlay, which allows the network to be identified and properly routed within the new network. This is a key step in enabling host migration at Layer 2.
